contentitemdata.kenticocommunity.qandaqu.QAndAQuestionPageContent:
I'm having an issue trying to get the CommunityPortal running locally. When I run it, the site starts and displays for a few seconds and then the process stops and I am getting error messages related to Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.Internal.Host and it would appear to be the Azure Storage Emulator local domains. Here is the output from my console:
info: Microsoft.Hosting.Lifetime[14] Now listening on: https://localhost:45039 info: Microsoft.Hosting.Lifetime[14] Now listening on: https://localhost:45040 info: Microsoft.Hosting.Lifetime[14] Now listening on: http://localhost:45038 info: Microsoft.Hosting.Lifetime[0] Application started. Press Ctrl+C to shut down. info: Microsoft.Hosting.Lifetime[0] Hosting environment: Development info: Microsoft.Hosting.Lifetime[0] Content root path: F:\Client Files\KenticoCommunity\community-portal\src\Kentico.Community.Portal.Web info: Vite.AspNetCore.Services.ViteDevServerStatus[0] Starting the vite development server... info: Vite.AspNetCore.Services.ViteDevServerStatus[0] Vite development server started with process ID 25472. info: Vite.AspNetCore.Services.ViteDevServerStatus[0] The Vite development server is running at https://localhost:5174 info: Vite.AspNetCore.Services.ViteManifest[0] The manifest file won't be read because the vite development service is enabled. The service will always return null chunks fail: Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.Internal.Host[9] BackgroundService failed System.AggregateException: Retry failed after 6 tries. Retry settings can be adjusted in ClientOptions.Retry or by configuring a custom retry policy in ClientOptions.RetryPolicy.
